bill_title: revise the renewal fees for physicians, physician assistants, physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, medical corporations, and physician assistant corporations.
keywords: Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the renewal fees for physicians, physician assistants, physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, medical corporations, and physician assistant corporations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-4-24.1 be amended to read as follows: 36-4-24.1. Each person receiving a license under the provisions of this chapter shall apply, on a form provided by the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners, for a renewal of his the license on or before the first day of March each year. Such The renewal shall be issued by the secretary upon payment of a fee to be fixed annually by the board, not exceeding the sum of one two hundred dollars. The renewal required hereunder shall be in the form of a receipt acknowledging payment of the required fee and signed by the secretary of the board. Section 2. That § 36-4A-34 be amended to read as follows: 36-4A-34. The fees in connection with a certificate as a physician's assistant shall be as follows: (1) For certificate by examination, not less than twenty-five dollars nor more than seventy-five dollars; (2) For reexamination within one year, not less than fifteen dollars nor more than forty-five dollars; (3) For certificate by reciprocity, not less than twenty-five dollars nor more than seventy-five dollars; (4) For renewal of a certificate, not more than fifteen one hundred dollars; (5) For reinstatement of a certificate, not less than five dollars nor more than twenty-five dollars; (6) For reissuance of a lost or destroyed certificate, following approval of the board, ten dollars. Section 3. That § 36-10-33 be amended to read as follows: 36-10-33. All licenses Any license issued by the board, pursuant to the provisions of this chapter, shall expire expires on the first day of January of the year next succeeding the issuance thereof. A license may be renewed upon the payment of a fee to be fixed annually, in rule, by the board not exceeding the sum of twenty-five fifty dollars. Failure of a licensee to renew his the license on or before the first day of July of each year shall constitute a forfeiture of the license. However, any person who has forfeited his a license under this chapter may have the license restored to him by making written application therefor and by payment of the annual renewal fee for the current year. Section 4. That § 47-11-12 be amended to read as follows: 47-11-12. Upon written application of the holder, accompanied by a fee of ten one hundred dollars, the Board of Medical and Osteopathic Examiners shall annually renew the certificate of registration if the board finds that the corporation has complied with its regulations and the provisions of this chapter. Section 5. That § 47-11D-13 be amended to read as follows: 47-11D-13. Upon written application of the holder, accompanied by a fee of ten one hundred dollars, the board shall annually renew the certificate of registration if the board finds that the corporation has compiled with its rules and the provisions of this chapter.
